column4: is it possible to have a kind of encryption, which allows the home folder to be mounted on login... several users on same dev
you can have encrypted file systems .. and have /home encrypted ..sure
but will it be mounted when a user logs in
i want the home folders to only be mounted when they are logged in.
if you have an entry for the filesystem in /etc/fstab .. it will be mounted when the computer is started up before any of the users log on
i only want the home folders to be mounted when they are logged in on the system
well, errm, if it's a desktop -- you start a system to log on to it and use it right -- whats wrong with having a disk mounted before the user logs on .. it saves some hassle

normal users cannot normally mount disks (atleast not so that they can be shared and used by multiple users) .. and if the filesystem is encrypted, you have nothing to worry about ..err, why else would you encrypt a file system?
but can different users use the same encrypted device?
yes, if it is mounted by root via /etc/fstab .. not otherwise
if both those folders is located at the same device... they wil both get mounted at the same time?
it's not the folders that will be mounted .. rather the disk that they reside on .. and since a device can only be mounted at once, it will happen "at the same time" :)
